title: Senior doctor filmed junior colleague belly dancing and told her he watched video every night before bed, hearing told
text:
A senior heart doctor sent a junior colleague a video of her belly dancing with the message: "I watch this every night before bed", a tribunal heard.

Consultant cardiologist Dr Dylmitr Rittoo, 59, filmed footage of her being given dance tuition during a staff leaving party before sending her the video over WhatsApp.

The woman, a Foundation Year One doctor known as Dr A, claimed the incident was one of several inappropriate compliments or contact by Rittoo whilst they worked at Arrowe Park Hospital on The Wirral.

He also sent the woman links to his favourite Bollywood movies and invited her to go on holiday with him to Mauritius, and would say how "stunningly beautiful she was."

Rittoo from Bromborough, Wirral, has worked at the hospital for 17 years but is facing accusations of sexually motivated misconduct at the Medical Practitioners Tribunal Service in Manchester.

The hearing was told the alleged incidents occurred when the pair worked together for four months between April and August 2015, after she was sent to the hospital on a placement.

Miss Georgina Goring lawyer, for the General Medical Council, said: "She met Dr Rittoo and he asked if she wanted to be involved in his research projects and asked her for her mobile telephone number and email address.
